It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough, serrated margin. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It is native to regions of eastern and southeastern Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. Pouzolzia mixta var. mixta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along streambanks.
